Articles.Content:
Before the changes to the wheels they had action group actions to enable and disable the motor. These actions are gone now. Everyone who transported rovers with rockets knows that it is imperative to disable the motors while on rockets or they suck all electricity. Please re-add the actions for activate, deactivate and TOGGLE (new) the rover wheel motors. This is missing for all rover wheel types!

 

Geezus!

Edited November 9, 2016 by DocMoriarty
Just checked it, you are right.
Noticed today when I was working on a new type of manual transmission. Yes, we need those back.
I've been using a walk-around...by avoiding the space bar and assigning engines to action groups.
My synthesizer won't work without them either.

Man, this friggin game hahaha....

I'm still on 1.X, so can't check myself. Is it possible to turn their motors all the way down, in lieu of power toggles? Do they still suck power if the parking brake is on? Does a docking port set to "disable crossfeed" stop EC transfer? Just a few ideas, I know they changed a lot of little stuff in 1.2.
I've found the missing actions ... inside the MK1 cockpit. Added this info in the bug report.

I'd made a bug report on this in the pre-release and it's been marked as confirmed but no further action on it. I'm just hoping that it's on someones pile of things to fix. http://bugs.kerbalspaceprogram.com/issues/11743
